Jack from the admin team through a deployment issue this evening. They ran a filter based upon ‘client assigned’ which returned 115 adjusters, 111 of which are selectable (not ‘currently deployed’ or ‘DNR’ed’). Jack clicked the ‘select all’ button to select all 111 adjusters and sent them a standby he created, confirming that he did indeed intend to send the standby to 111 individuals. However the standby was sent to the entire roster (9,800 people!!).

I had him create the standby and run the filter again, but this time I had him click the ‘select all’ button and then unselect a few people so the ‘select all’ button would be unchecked, and then reselect the people he unselected. This still showed 111 people selected and the confirmation box also indicated 111, and when he actually deployed these people it only went to the 111 as expected.

The API endpoint detailed in OD-119 has been extended to allow the JSON body to include a billing element with a variationType boolean attribute that will be populated into a field named Billing Variation in the target TrackVia view.

Example JSON:

{
  "data": {
    "property": {
      "stories": 3,
      "pitch": "7/12"
    },
    "fieldResource": {
      "name": "Josh Harden",
      "type": "Drone Pilot",
      "payrollID": "XYZ987"
    },
    "billing": {
      "extraRoofServices": true,
      "variationType": "CAC"
    }
  }
}

Or, just:

{
  "data": {
    "billing": {
      "variationType": "TC"
    }
  }
}

The variationType value may be any string but for the ease of reliably referencing the values in TrackVia formulas it is suggested the values supplied are "Code" strings in the form:

  • EC (i.e. "Erroneous Claim")
  • CAC (i.e. "Canceled After Contact")
  • TC (i.e. "trip charge")

","id":"4-321","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"ch","name":"Chris Heywood","$type":"User"},"created":1600088206731,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

The API endpoint detailed in OD-119 has been extended to allow the JSON body to include a billing element with a extraRoofServices boolean attribute that will be populated into a field named Roof Measure/Diagram Add On in the target TrackVia view.

Example JSON:

{
  "data": {
    "property": {
      "stories": 3,
      "pitch": "7/12"
    },
    "fieldResource": {
      "name": "Josh Harden",
      "type": "Drone Pilot",
      "payrollID": "XYZ987"
    },
    "billing": {
      "extraRoofServices": true,
      "variationType": "CAC"
    }
  }
}

Or, just:

{
  "data": {
    "billing": {
      "extraRoofServices": true
    }
  }
}

The extraRoofServices value may be supplied as "Yes", "Y", true, 1, "No", "N", false, 0 or left empty.

    /**
     * @return HasOneThrough
     */
    public function dronePilot () {
        return $this->userAssignment()
                    ->where(['type' => UserAssignments::TYPE_DRONE]);
    }
    
    /**
     * @return HasOneThrough
     */
    public function fieldInspector () {
        return $this->userAssignment()
                    ->where(['type' => UserAssignments::TYPE_FIELD]);
    }

","id":"4-136","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"ch","name":"Chris Heywood","$type":"User"},"created":1596109458935,"updated":1596109694970,"textPreview":"

Hey @Kris Anolfo, I can't find details of the billing calc that is gonna need to be done in TV using the stories, pitch & field inspector / drone resource information.
Wondering if we're gonna need the stories / pitch to be numeric? E.g. if the billing calc is gonna include anything like stories >= where it relies on doing numeric operation?
In the OnDemand MySQL database I'm seeing that assignment_property_data has the stories/pre_dominate_pitch/steepest_pitch columns as varchar(255) data types, although where the stories has so far been populated so far it's actually numeric (there are no examples of the pitch columns being populated so far).
Any thoughts on how we'll need the data to be structured in TV? E.g. are simple text values going to be adequate?

","id":"4-169","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"ch","name":"Chris Heywood","$type":"User"},"created":1596112161020,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Hey again @Kris Anolfo, on a similar note, what data do we need stored on each claim in TV for the field inspector / drone resource? For example, for each claim in TV we could just have:

  • Field Inspector ID
  • Field Inspector Name
  • Drone Resource ID
  • Drone Resource Name
    Each of those IDs could maybe just be the id from the users table in the OnDemand MySQL database (since that's where this info is gonna be coming from to start with).
    Or is there a bunch of other info that would be needed for billing? E.g. an actual Employee ID and/or each person's email address or other stuff?
    If there are many additional data points needed for each person then we'll need to decide whether we handle that by either:
  1. adding those data points into the OnDemand database so it can send that info over to TV for each claim; or
  2. setting up a central, linked table in TV that stores this info for each person but with a sync process or link identifier to hook into the OnDemand database, e.g. so TV gets a user ID from OnDemand and can link that to its person table to infer the other data points.
    Option 1 seems like it might be easiest/best but it would rely it being possible to maintain that data in the OnDemand app (it limits our reliance on maintaining key data in TV though?).
","id":"4-170","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"ch","name":"Chris Heywood","$type":"User"},"created":1596113861453,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Another consideration on this is that for each carrier in OnDemand it's ideally going to need to tell any new API I set-up what the relevant TrackVia "View ID" is when it's sending over any claim data. The TV API will need that because these claims are stored in separate client apps/tables in TrackVia, e.g. there's a different app and different table/view for SFI versus other clients, etc. So, maybe, the carriers table in OnDemand is going to need to have a tv_view_id column added to it so it can pass that along with any request to update a claim in TV.

","id":"4-171","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"garthpmurray","name":"Garth Murray","$type":"User"},"created":1596114096655,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Roof Pitch is stored in another table in a JSON column. mobile_inspections:data where name is InspectionStepRoofBasic Comes in as a fraction. 1/2, 9/12, etc

","id":"4-172","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"Kanolfo","name":"Kris Anolfo","$type":"User"},"created":1596114816151,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

I'm dropping these instructions I received from Falin in here for our discussion about this:

Billing
Each file will be billed at $300 per file for the pilot and then $385 after the pilot. It may make sense to have drop down and do a calculated field that will reduce if that drop down says (pilot).   We will be automatically generating the billing invoices from the On Demand System -> XA but need to track for A/R

Fees
For the Field Inspectors / Drone Resources -  their name/email should be pushed from the On Demand Web Application (it will be attached to the specific claim number)

For the Desk Adjuster - their information will push over as the XACTNET address.  So Maxwell or whoever will need to continue to add adjusters to that linked XACTNET Adjusters app

Calculated Fee to be paid to Field Inspector / Drone Resources:
1 Story Inspection: $95.00
2 Stories or More: $20.00 add on
Pitch > 7/12: $40 add on

For Example:  2 Story 9/12 Roof would be $155.

Flat Fee to be paid to the Desk Adjuster:

$95.00 per file

@Garth Murray Spent yesterday doing some research on the spatie/laravel-activity package and it seems to be more or less a mirror of the owen-it/laravel-auditing package. Spatie does let you do line-item logging but that's something that jeremykennedy/laravel-logger allows you to do, on top of the route-tracing AND the laravel-logger package comes with an interface for viewing the log whereas with laravel-activity we'd need to build a full customized interface, similar to what we already did for laravel-auditing over on BS1.

If you like I can take some time to better compare laravel-activity to laravel-auditing and see which one might work better, but laravel-logger seems to have a different feature set that I think we still want.

Test/live API endpoints are the same as for attachments, notes, reassignment etc and using the same API key:
https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemandTEST/ for test and https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemand/ for live.

POST to /ondemand[TEST]/assignments/{transactionID}/tv/{viewId}

The body of the POST is JSON in the form:

{
  "data": {
    "property": {
      "stories": 3,
      "pitch": "7/12"
    },
    "fieldResource": {
      "name": "Josh Harden",
      "type": "Drone Pilot",
      "payrollID": "XYZ987"
    }
  }
}

The "data" object should contain at least one value but doesn't need to contain all of the possible values, e.g. these are also valid:

{
  "data": {
    "property": {
      "stories": 5
    }
  }
}

{
  "data": {
    "property": {
      "pitch": "2/12"
    },
    "fieldResource": {
      "name": "Patsy Hangdog",
      "payrollID": "ABC001"
    }
  }
}

Valid viewId values are currently:

  • SFI (carrier_id 3985225): 1339
  • Demo (carrier_id 2642910): 1563

The call is processed and forwarded over to TrackVia immediately and will straightaway either return 200 Success or 400 error. When there's an error there'll be a JSON body of the form: {"error": "invalid TV view ID"}.

This should fire when the claim hits QA approved. At that point the system should send FI pay to TrackVia using the Story count and pitch data to determine the amount. It should also send DA pay @$95. Just thinking for the future we need a way to mark if the FI or DA is on salary and to not generate a payment in TV. @Garth Murray @Falin McMellon @Kris Anolfo

PHP

if (isset($_GET['fcm_token']) && !empty($_GET['fcm_token'])) {
    
    $registration_id = isset($_GET['fcm_token']) && !empty($_GET['fcm_token']) ? $_GET['fcm_token'] : '';
    
    $fields = [
        
        'registration_ids' => [$registration_id],
        
        'data' => [
            
            'message' => 'You have been assigned a new claim',
            
            'title' => 'Claim Assigned',
        
        ],
    
    ];
    
    $headers = [
        'Authorization: key=AAAAzf7YaO8:APA91bHbgKv_5f1FdC6sp_JNmTA3yAeC0CUEcgiXeVFdXvyZHE9pCV9WLG_bL0W_Ml4_SwwNEKkMoZPJnrR4lbSHIyMFiTGOuy5XM1h_im_7DhrU7mB9briXQwuxIuzq13yG0JhLTGTF',
        
        'Content-Type: application/json',
    
    ];
    
    $ch = curl_init();
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, 'https://fcm.googleapis.com/fcm/send');
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, TRUE);
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, TRUE);
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, 0);
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, FALSE);
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, json_encode($fields));
    
    $result = curl_exec($ch);
    if ($result === FALSE) {
        response(400, "Something went wrong");
    }
    
    curl_close($ch);
    $explode = explode(",", $result);
    $new_exp = explode(":", $explode[1]);
    if ($new_exp[1] == 0) {
        response(400, "Incorrect Token");
    } else {
        response(200, "Notification sent successfully.");
    }
} else {
    response(400, "FCM token required");
}

function response ($status, $status_message) {
    header("HTTP/1.1 " . $status);
    
    $response['status'] = $status;
    $response['message'] = $status_message;
    
    $json_response = json_encode($response);
    echo $json_response;
}

Here's how to call the new API:

Same end points you're using for the attachments and notes, i.e.:
https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemandTEST/ for test and https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemand/ for live, using the same API key you're using already.

POST to /ondemand[TEST]/assignments/{transactionID}/reassign

The body of the POST is this form of JSON:
{
"XNAddress": "GLOBAL.SARASOTA.FL.TEST",
"XM8UserId": "CH"
}

As with the Notes endpoint the call is going to be processed and forwarded over to Xact immediately and will straightaway either return 200 Success or 400 error. When there's an error there'll be a JSON body like this: {"error": "no XNAddress"}.

You'll note there's an XM8UserId attribute in the JSON. That's actually optional, i.e. you can just send the XNAddress and leave out the XM8UserId attribute altogether. BUT, I've discussed this with Elizabeth at Xact and she says "You don’t necessarily have to send over the XM8 userid, but it will default to the main user on the account, and instead of going directly to the assigned user the assignment will show up under ‘all projects’, if that makes sense." Which doesn't actually make a whole lot of sense to me! But I think we just need to try it in the live environment and see how it comes through in Xact when you just send, say, an XNAddress of GLOBAL.EV.JUSTIN.SARASOTA.FL.2 without a XM8UserId.

\App\Http\Controllers\PdfController holds the current start point for making a pdf to view, you can use this to test things.

\App\Components\PDFBuilder\PDFBuilder holds all the stuff for actually creating a PDF.

\App\Console\Commands\CreateAssignmentPdfs::handle contains a block of PDFs to be generated and saved, simply add the invoice one to that list and you'll be good.

\App\Components\PDFBuilder\CreatePDF::getPDF contains the actual code to generate the PDF

","id":"4-110","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"garthpmurray","name":"Garth Murray","$type":"User"},"created":1595517962461,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Inspection status
has photos uploaded

  • goes into review queue

Can only see their own queue
Admin can see all

Log time when Photos uploaded to system - display time/date + difference between created date
Log time when photos most recently uploaded to XA - difference between Photos uploaded
Log time when Docs Uploaded to XA - Display time
Log time time when XA in-review status was set - display time.

To log the XA in-review status change, create table that captures the status_id column change:

  • what it was
  • what it changed to
  • when it occurred
  • and who did it.

QA Approved status removes the assignment from their queue entirely.

Add navigation path to left hand side bar.
Depending on how complicated the count query will be, add a linked count badge of the number in the queue

List of photos will need to be pulled into a PDF. Should create a new Photo Sheet with each creation, add to documents list to allow upload to XA as with any document.

filename: #claimnumber_photo_sheet.pdf

Pdf will require:
Insured name - Assignment->insurance
Claim # -Assignment->claim_number
Policy # -Assignment->policy_number

Should be added to the PDF in same order they are displayed on the web application
Risk -> Elevation -> roof -> etc

Each photo will require-
Date Taken: uploaded date
Taken By: inspected by
Location: insured address
Image Name: image name
Comments: comments

An auto-resizing process has now been hooked into the grsondemandapp S3 bucket.
For testing purposes the process initially ignores all uploads apart from those uploaded to claim id 10, i.e. only images uploaded to grsondemandapp/10/photos will be resized.
The process can be expanded to include any other test claims and can be applied to the whole bucket when testing is complete.
The process targets png, jpg, jpeg, webp, tif and tiff files and will automatically resize them to 3 different dimensions with the resized versions output to subfolders as follows:

  • bucket/<id>/photos/web/<image> (max-width: 1000px, max-height: 900px)
  • bucket/<id>/photos/sheet/<image> (max-width: 700px, max-height: 600px)
  • bucket/<id>/photos/thumb/<image> (fixed width: 240px, fixed height: 178px)

We will be creating the necessary functionality to allow for any images uploaded to the On-Demand S3 Bucket to be resized to the 3 different generally used image sizes.

Ondemand bucket: grsondemandapp

original image path: bucket/<id>/photos/<image>
resize image path suggestion: bucket/<id>/photos-resized/<image>

Photosheet:

  • respects image proportions
    max-width:700px;
    max-height:600px;

Thumbnail:

  • force image size
    width: 240
    height: 178

Web Image:

  • respects image proportions
    max-width:1000px;
    max-height:900px;

I would rather it just take you to the claim. Is that not doable? @Rick Dupont

","id":"4-260","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"rdupont","name":"Rick Dupont","$type":"User"},"created":1596829981686,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

As per discussion with @Justin Cook on slack:

So what you want is to be able to put in an exact claim number and go to that entry?
I can likely do some sort of fetch and match. If no match is found, it would send you to the assignments page with that text being the search term.
So the flow would be:
input search term into the text box and hit search.
If the search term matches an assignment's claim number exactly, go to that assignment
Otherwise, go to the assignment index page with that term as a pre-filled out filter search

Test/live API endpoints are the same as for attachments, notes, reassignment, and using the same API key:
https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemandTEST/ for test and https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemand/ for live.

POST to /ondemand[TEST]/assignments/{transactionID}/setstatus

The body of the POST is JSON in this form:
{
"status": "Appointment Scheduled",
"datetime": "2020-07-24T12:34:56Z",
"userId": "cheywood"
}

The call is processed and forwarded over to Xact immediately and will straightaway either return 200 Success or 400 error. When there's an error there'll be a JSON body of this form: {"error": "invalid status"}.

Valid statuses are:
Job Started
Job Completed
Contacted
Appointment Scheduled
Appointment Cancelled
Planned Inspection
Inspected
Not Sold
Reviewed
Rejected
QA Rejected
QA Approved
Client Approved
Client Rejected
File Closed
File Reopened

If a time zone is not specified with the datetime then it is presumed to be UTC.

The userid is required (and is not the same as an XactNet address).

","id":"4-115","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"rdupont","name":"Rick Dupont","$type":"User"},"created":1595611192695,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

If we are running this every 5 minutes, we will be updating records ~20 times with the same information, or at least checking each field for changes. I think laravel is smart enough to not trigger a save update on a field that has no actual field changes, but do we want to do any sort of validation that a record has already been updated? Compare it's updated_at to the timestamp?

","id":"4-117","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"garthpmurray","name":"Garth Murray","$type":"User"},"created":1595614448741,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Yeah lets either confirm that Laravel doesn't trigger an update on unchanged columns or logic that prevents 20 updates.

Also you can set the startAt(strtotime('-1 hour')); to something like -10 mins so it only tries to update those that changed in the last 10 mins

","id":"4-118","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"rdupont","name":"Rick Dupont","$type":"User"},"created":1595615005366,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

So if no fields have changed, the ->save() function won't fire and trigger the update_at field changing.

But I also think checking every 10 minutes should be fine, the chances of us having hundreds of records to sort through is not likely, so a project should be picked up on at least one of two passes.

Here is the step function execution I found was causing issues

https://console.aws.amazon.com/states/home?region=us-east-1#/executions/details/arn:aws:states:us-east-1:293415089511:execution:OnDemandAddAttachments:be12a3e1-4b7d-46e8-9113-1dfdf4fb20ad

","id":"4-134","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"ch","name":"Chris Heywood","$type":"User"},"created":1596185993938,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

I've identified that this was due to a quota applying to AWS step functions - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/step-functions/latest/dg/limits.html#service-limits-task-executions - where there's a limit of 32,768 characters for the JSON state passed from one task to another.
When a large number of photos was being processed, particularly when some of them were causing Xact errors by there being "illegal" characters in their filenames, the overall result state being passed between task steps was exceeding the 32,768 quota, mainly when processing the final outcome to pass back to OnDemand.
I've now optimised the JSON state data passed between tasks to reduce its size so batches of up to approx. 150 attachments should be processed without the quota being exceeded.
As has been discussed with @Garth Murray, it will be advisable to set some limit in OnDemand on the number of attachments that can be sent at once to Xact, e.g. perhaps not more than 150 per batch, particularly sicne it's recently been observed that photos are being sent of between 5MB and 7MB each, so sending a batch of 100 of those is a significant amount of data to be transferring to Xact (and the Xact API is very slow to receive/process each individual attachment).

","id":"4-167","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"ch","name":"Chris Heywood","$type":"User"},"created":1596101892646,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Confirmed! This issue isn't due to photo file size but due to the characters in the photo file names, particularly the \ character, but the Xact API also errors if filenames include any of the following characters: <>:"/\\|?*.
Not only that, the Xact API (which must be using a Windows server in the chain at some point) errors if the filename happens to be any of the following: CON, PRN, AUX, NUL, COM1, COM2, COM3, COM4, COM5, COM6, COM7, COM8, COM9, LPT1, LPT2, LPT3, LPT4, LPT5, LPT6, LPT7, LPT8, LPT9
So a photo named aux.png will error, for example.
I've added validation to the OnDemand API now (that send the photos/documents to the Xact API) to check for any of those characters/strings that Xact can't handle and will automatically make them safe. So the OnDemand app can continue to use those characters/string and the photos/documents will flow into Xact without errors.
In the Xact test environment I've rerun the batch that previously failed due to \ characters in the filenames (per state machine https://console.aws.amazon.com/states/home?region=us-east-1#/executions/details/arn:aws:states:us-east-1:293415089511:execution:OnDemandAddAttachments:82065572-b022-45a6-8717-1edfa4807b23) and all 56 photos were successfully sent to Xact, see https://beta.xactanalysis.com/apps/xactanalysis/detail.jsp?mfn=006VZ3Q&ddid=006VZ3Q&xlink=true#d_imgdigital (per state machine https://console.aws.amazon.com/states/home?region=us-east-1#/executions/details/arn:aws:states:us-east-1:293415089511:execution:OnDemandAddAttachments:TEST-71928e3d-3093-fc0e-b0b2-9001dffe054a)

","id":"4-168","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"garthpmurray","name":"Garth Murray","$type":"User"},"created":1596114460194,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Firebase project function buildFromAssignment looks at the xact_assignment "home_phone" field for filling out the insuredPhoneNumber data. However, not all numbers will always be filled out.

As per discussion with Justin Cook, send the Mobile number if available, if not then send Home, and finally if neither of those are filled out send Business.

We've purchased the Metronic Theme from themeforest.com and will be utilizing that for our frontend design.

Initially the basic setup should be able to pinpoint what are the necessary files needed for us to start building with this theme

Metronic ships with a version of it's theme tailored for Laravel, however it also depends heavily on Node.js to run. We won't be utilizing Node at this stage. So while we can utilize the Laravel setup as a guideline, we will be building most of the template from scratch.

Ability to add buildings to inspection
Name
Is Damaged
Description
and the appropriate Elevations

{
  "Is there damage to Left Elevation?": {
    "damaged": true,
    "description": "Hail damage to the downspouts"
  },
  "Is there damage to Rear Elevation?": {
    "damaged": true,
    "description": "Hail damage to one window"
  },
  "Is there damage to Front Elevation?": {
    "damaged": false,
    "description": null
  },
  "Is there damage to Right Elevation?": {
    "damaged": true,
    "description": "Hail damage to paint"
  }
}

Answer the following questions, is there damage to the section, if so

{
    "Wind Damage": "0",
    "Hail Hits": "0"
}

InspectionStepFront - 'Are there visible damages to the front elevation?'
InspectionStepRight - 'Are there visible damages to the right elevation?'
InspectionStepRear - 'Are there visible damages to the rear elevation?'
InspectionStepLeft - 'Are there visible damages to the left elevation?'

use the Storm Report Api

Create new table to hold per assignment table

@Kris Anolfo just to clarify, we want new inputs on just the admin adjuster view to capture policy company name, policy number, and effective dates or on both?

","id":"4-0","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"Kanolfo","name":"Kris Anolfo","$type":"User"},"created":1581956350074,"updated":1589909240733,"textPreview":"

@Garth Murray the problem we have with this data is is twofold.

  1. On the 1099 employment application the adjuster is asked if they have their own policy and if they do they are instructed to provide their WC information by typing in the policy company name, policy number or self-insurance permit number, coverage start and end dates, and then upload a photo of the policy. Instead of uploading a copy of their policy they'll upload a copy of their driver's license or a picture of their cat.

  2. In BridgeSource the field Workers Compensation Deduction (should) defaults to not reviewed until admin reviews the adjuster's employment application. They will change the field to deduct from payroll if the adjuster does not carry their own policy and wants to enrol in ours or no deduction if the adjuster has provided correct WC information.

The first problem is what to do with those who state they have their own policy, but did not provide the required information thus requiring some sort of follow up from the admin team, The Workers Compensation Deduction dropdown options of not reviewed, deduct from payroll, and no deduction don't fully apply to them yet because they did not provide the required information. Having a third option such as invalid documentation would help identify these adjusters.

The second problem is that we are not capturing any of their WC data in their profiles - none of the data they provide is being entered into their profile and there's no place to upload the documentation they send to us. I don't think we need text fields for policy company name or policy number if we are going to upload the policy itself. However I do think we should capture coverage start date and coverage end date. Knowing these dates will allow us to determine if the adjuster had coverage during the days they were deployed to a project (since the projects should capture start and release dates) and could also help us track adjusters who have expired policies - maybe having those with coverage end date after "today" can automatically turn to invalid documentation.

","id":"4-1","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"garthpmurray","name":"Garth Murray","$type":"User"},"created":1589566581678,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Workers Compensation Deduction should default to unreviewed on new profiles.

Add status column for valid/invalid Works Compensation Deduction This will only apply if Workers Compensation Deduction is No Deduction.

Add capture points for Policy Company Name Policy Number Coverage Start Coverage End - On admin side. Only show these fields if No Deduction is chosen for Workers Compensation Deduction

Flip status column to valid if all fields are filled out and current date is inside the Start End.

if Status column is marked as invalid, fields outlined in red.

Cron job that runs and marks status column as invalid if date falls after end date of coverage. Ignore other Workers Compensation Deduction options.

On adjuster search page:
Fix Workers Compensation Deduction to match fields if they map to the same column. If not, lets circle back.

Add a filter for those with an invalid status column from above.

","id":"4-56","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"rdupont","name":"Rick Dupont","$type":"User"},"created":1590691791750,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

@Garth Murray instead of a valid/invalid column, would it be better to create an attribute similar to how we are doing deployable, where we check certain fields for data or validity and then return a true/false? This way we don't need to have a cron job run and we can have that validity instantly updated whenever the given fields are updated.

","id":"4-77","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"garthpmurray","name":"Garth Murray","$type":"User"},"created":1590692234691,"updated":1590692247920,"textPreview":"

How are you going to invalidate the date when it is past with that method?

","id":"4-78","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"garthpmurray","name":"Garth Murray","$type":"User"},"created":1590692395273,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Or if you're talking about a computed attribute, that isn't bad, but handling large data sets and having many computed attribute fields on it can be intensive.

","id":"4-79","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"rdupont","name":"Rick Dupont","$type":"User"},"created":1590692646480,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Yeah I meant a computed attribute.

Since this is a filterable attribute, I would handle the filter similar to how we are handling dependability, having it be done via SQL. So anywhere we would want to fetch it via the database we could do a "polilcy_coverage_end > NOW()". Doing the computation via SQL would be a lot faster than trying to do it via PHP, and this way the data is always accurate rather than being behind a cron job.

I'll make sure to test performance when doing the filtering on larger data sets, and if the computation is too much I'll move ahead with a boolean field that is set via cron job.

On the User Management page add an option to bulk upload users. Utilize a similar design as the bulk upload of assignments.

System should loop through csv, extra the necessary data and create the users based on the role column in the csv. Skip admin role type.

Role will determine what fields are required for the user.

If there is an error display the row number and data, if the email already exists inform the user that the email was skipped because it exists.

Fields on the Claim Intake Form need to be revised. Change all of the formatted fields to be single line or number fields so they can be integrated with Xact in the future.

In addition, make all fields required except for Mobile Phone and Email Address.

Add the following two questions as dropdown with Yes/No as responses. If Yes is selected for either question then an option to upload documentation needs to appear.

Are there any prior claims that should be considered on this loss?
Are there any policy endorsements that should be considered?

There are several missing elements from the assignments page. Needs to be updated and the following added to it.

Remove loss type
Show all 3 phonenumbers
Better Date formatting - Month, Day year
Always show pencil

Weather -
Add max hailsize and damage probability to storm details

Property Data
Unit B or Number B on assignment 11 to check better data
Scrollable box for drone information

Photos -
Upload Photo doesn’t allow click
Upload Photo Rework - do line by line.

Documents
Same upload rework, allow type
uploaded by needs to be name

When choosing a number of Adjusters to deploy from the adjusters search page, the count of number selected is buried at the bottom of the page.

This has resulted in multiple notifications being sent out to users.

In the Standby and Deployment popup please add a count of the currently selected adjusters that this will be going to as well as a confirmation checkbox that they have to check in order to send out the notification.

"You are sending this notification to X adjusters. Check here that this is correct."

Can use the DataTables logic to pull in total number of users and the like.

SELECT users_deployments.id AS user_deployment_id, users.firstname, users.lastname, deployments.incident_name, concat("https://portal.grsbridge.com/adjuster/", users.id) as user_profile_link, concat("https://portal.grsbridge.com/deployments/roster/all/", deployments.id) as user_profile_link FROM users_deployments LEFT JOIN users ON users.id = users_deployments.adjuster_id LEFT JOIN deployments ON deployments.id = users_deployments.deployment_id WHERE users_deployments.active = 1 AND adjuster_id IN ( SELECT adjuster_id FROM users_deployments WHERE active = 1 GROUP BY adjuster_id HAVING count(deployment_id) > 1 ) ORDER BY adjuster_id

","id":"4-64","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"rdupont","name":"Rick Dupont","$type":"User"},"created":1590002525112,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Added some CSVs of user data. Looks like there were 9 users set as "active" in deployments that didn't exist, all admins. Set those to active = 0.

Also discovered 24 adjusters with multiple deployments set as active. Created a CSV and sent to @Kris Anolfo for further research.

Ran the following SQL commands to create the missing records quickly so the system would be usable:

INSERT INTO users_grs_data (adjuster_id) SELECT id FROM adjusters.users WHERE id NOT IN (select adjuster_id FROM users_grs_data) AND type="adjuster"

INSERT INTO users_qualifications (adjuster_id) SELECT id FROM adjusters.users WHERE id NOT IN (select adjuster_id FROM users_qualifications) AND type="adjuster"

INSERT INTO users_data (adjuster_id) SELECT id FROM adjusters.users WHERE id NOT IN (select adjuster_id FROM users_data) AND type="adjuster"

The users_data table did not have any missing rows, but grs_data and qualifications did.

Searching for certain newly created users triggered the error "Exception Message:\n\nTrying to get property 'dnr' of non-object". Attempting to visit the user's page manually showed similar issues.

Investigation into the database showed around 6 users were missing entries into the users_grs_data. Investigate how this occurred.

After discussing this with Jeff, he now understands that the total on the NFIP report matches the total on the Master report because it’s counting everyone in the database. Jeff said that made sense to him and he was fine with it for now. Ideally the report should reflect those with NFIP experience who have at least 4 years experience since that is the requirement set by NFIP. Anyone with NFIP and less than 4 years experience is mistaken about one of them — they either aren’t NFIP certified or they have more experience than they indicated in BridgeSource. So at this current time we don't need to make any revisions to this report.

Garth Murray wrote on 22 May 2020 22:11:
{quote}Needs a default value or to be set to nullable{quote}

Discovered when creating a deployment, currently the fix has been to set the column to null in production. If nullable then this ticket can be closed after updating the migration.

if not then will need to add a new migration that adds a default value and updates the current table back to not-nullable

This may be able to be fixed alongside changes made in BS-16 since part of that process is to disable the "autosave" feature. We implemented a check upon tab change to see if there were changes, and if so, save those changes. We can easily add in an additional check that if the save does not return a success, we prevent moving from one tab to the other. This should allow the user to fix or undo the problem.

If there is an error (such as missing a required field like e-mail address) then an error message is displayed when navigating between tabs in an adjuster profile. This prevents the success message when saving a record which can lead to uncertainty. It also disables the "Last Updated by:" at the bottom, showing only as blank.

Integrate Chris's image api to submit images to Xact

A RESTful API to send requests for images to be transferred from S3 to Xact:

TEST: POST https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemandTEST/assignments/{transactionId}/attachments
LIVE: POST https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemand/assignments/{transactionId}/attachments

Where {transactionId} is the transactionId of the assignment in Xact you want to send attachments to, e.g.:
TEST https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemandTEST/assignments/006TVSS/attachments
LIVE https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemand/assignments/03YRN18/attachments

The Content-Type should be "application/json" and you need to include the API key 4iiAo9qVpD60FD7dGGfeC14OV7fNkrLp8VvWkb5S in an "x-api-key" header.

The JSON to post should follow the format below, which is basically an array of attachment objects:

[ { "id": 1234, "key": "6/photos/ycnYxyd7q5BVcXIfBDLMdAjAQNihjUpj36yCUSvC.jpeg", "filename": "house.png", "description": "testing", "datetime": "2020-03-18T18:25:31Z" }, { "id": 2345, "key": "6/photos/0nJERpPiCSEmw1MUuCQ48WiKOSHl32PAbPplEjqh.jpeg", "filename": "flashing.jpeg", "datetime": "2020-03-18T16:23:52Z" }, { "id": 2, "key": "6/photos/r0y4MXIaFh0ysZRjpLE1KCoO3UiWVgBI4SX1nYZc.jpeg", "datetime": "2020-03-18T16:23:52Z" } ]
All of the attachment properties are optional apart from the "key" (which represents the key within the S3 grsondemandapp bucket), with the other values being assigned defaults based on the "key" or current date or position within the array as necessary. So, this is also a valid request:

[ { "key": "19/photos/5yVxwV06sZDSmseu9zE3V4kVsJtecSsgDkT1rw3F.png" } ]

A successful post to the API will return the HTTP status code 202, i.e. "Accepted", because the request is received for processing but is currently pending, i.e. nothing has been downloaded from S3 or sent to Xact yet.

Once a request has been accepted then it will be processed as follows:

  1. the attachment keys will be verified in S3 and any invalid/non-existent attachments will be discarded (and logged as failed);
  2. using the content-lengths reported by S3 for each file, the files will be grouped (using a first-fit-descending bin-packing algorithm!) so no single group exceeds 20MB (that's a configurable threshold);
  3. each attachment group will be sent via a separate POST request to Xact;
  4. when all of the attachment groups have been sent to Xact (or failed to be sent) a JSON response is available that details the success/fail status of every attachment.

The final result that is available to be posted back to an OnDemand API has this format (note the "success" true/false property for each attachment):

{ "transactionId": "03YRN18", "attachments": [ { "id": 1234, "key": "6/photos/ycnYxyd7q5BVcXIfBDLMdAjAQNihjUpj36yCUSvC.jpeg", "filename": "house.png", "description": "testing", "datetime": "2020-03-18T18:25:31Z", "contentLength": 7548445, "success": true }, { "id": 2345, "key": "6/photos/0nJERpPiCSEmw1MUuCQ48WiKOSHl32PAbPplEjqh.jpeg", "filename": "flashing.jpeg", "datetime": "2020-03-18T16:23:52Z", "contentLength": 7476024, "success": true }, { "id": 2, "key": "6/photos/invalid.jpeg", "datetime": "2020-03-18T16:23:52Z", "success": false } ] }

","id":"4-35","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"rdupont","name":"Rick Dupont","$type":"User"},"created":1586886334111,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Hey @Kris Anolfo, it looks like most if not all of the emails are in the "resources -> views -> notifications" folder on the git repository. The "Request Update" email uses the generic "default.blade.php" template.

  • Welcome Email - "welcome.blade.php"
  • Training Email - training.blade.php
  • Standy - standby.blade.php
  • New User - new-user.blade.php
  • Deploy - deploy.blade.php
  • Request Update - default.blade.php

The Rejected Deployment Request is less of an email and more of a response page. That is found in "resources -> view -> deployments"

  • rejected - reject.blade.php
  • accept - accept.blade.php
  • accept standby - accept-standy-blade.php
  • accept training - accept-training-blade.php
  • (New) Cutoff reject - cutoff.blade.php
  • Error page - error.blade.php

That's what I can see so far.

","id":"4-28","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"rdupont","name":"Rick Dupont","$type":"User"},"created":1586455394444,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

As far as I can tell, this is a field in the database that a few different methods will change to a given status (1 = No, 2 = Yes, 3 = "DNR", 4 = "Currently Deployed").

So it's less of a formula and more of a series of different functions that will set it based on that action or condition. The methods to accept/reject a deployment will set it to either 2 (reject) or 4 (currently deployed). The user profile update page will manually change it to whatever is set in the drop down (unless DNR is selected, then it will set it to that). And the deployment end function is supposed to set them to 2 (Yes), which as BS-12 shows does not work as expected.

That's all I could find so far.

","id":"4-32","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"rdupont","name":"Rick Dupont","$type":"User"},"created":1586893133678,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

@Kris Anolfo so from what I can tell, on initial user set up a user is considered deployable as long as they are not flagged as "DNR". Upon update of a user profile, again a user is set as Deployable as long as they are not currently deployed and are not flagged as DNR.

As per discussion with @Kris Anolfo - adjusters sitting in "pending' can be released by removing notification. This will allow the the user to receive a new invitation to either accept/reject, and will remove that user from the limbo "pending".

The action button has also been removed for "rejected" and "released" users as there was no actions to be taken for those states.

The ability to re-accept is not possible with the current database, that feature will be looked into when developing version 2.

@Kris Anolfo what are the conditions that we'd like to check against when verifying if a user is able to accept a sent out invitation? We can of course check to make sure that the end_date isn't set (or if it is set, is set in the future), do we need to check to ensure that the "limit" doesn't match the current number of active adjusters assigned to that deployment? Are there any other conditions that should be taken into consideration?

@Rick Dupont following up on our conversation on this from Friday, the new email template should be:

This Deployment Is Not Accepting Additional Adjusters

Hello [name], the first wave of the GRS deployment request dated {date} has been satisfied. Thank you for your interest. Please continue to monitor your email on file. If/when any additional waves are needed or additional assignment opportunities arise, we will contact you via email.

endless emails","reporter":{"login":"garthpmurray","$type":"User"},"attachments":[],"comments":[{"author":{"login":"rdupont","name":"Rick Dupont","$type":"User"},"created":1586266047626,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

After working my way through the code I think I noticed something that may compound some of the issues we have. The code as written has a "limit 300" for the initial query, and at first glance I thought it meant "pull 300 emails at one", but really what this does is just pull 300 "deployment ids" and then fetches the individual messages in a second loop. So that initial query actually returns, from my test data, 14 deployments, and then loops through all non-notified users inside that deployment. So that "limit' really doesn't mean anything in the long run for limiting the number of emails being sent in a particular batch.

If we want to ensure that emails of a similar deployment are sent "together" we can certainly adjust the flow to work through notifications ordered by their deployment ID, but I'm not sure how important that is. I think the important thing is is place the limits on what truly matters: the number of users being pulled to send emails to.

I guess there are a few different ways to approach this:

  1. Minor tweaks that simply adds a "processing" state that is set as the information is being compiled and then updated to a "processed" state after the email is sent
  2. Minor rewrite to the logic flow that centers around adding the limits to the appropriate place.
  3. Major rewrite from the ground up that uses model relations and scopes to avoid needing to use so much raw SQL calls.

Which way do you think is best?

","id":"4-13","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"garthpmurray","name":"Garth Murray","$type":"User"},"created":1586267302870,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Yeah that 300 deployment limit is pointless in the extreme since we don't even have that many active deployments around.

The solution I would go with is a combination of 1 and 2. The processing status flag needs to be there to prevent duplicate executions and sane limits need to be in place for batch executions

","id":"4-14","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"garthpmurray","name":"Garth Murray","$type":"User"},"created":1586267677601,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Remove the deployment loop and just send out the notifications per @Kris Anolfo and I's slack convo

","id":"4-15","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"rdupont","name":"Rick Dupont","$type":"User"},"created":1586293505181,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Had to do some debugging in my git program of choice (SourceTree) to get Git to finally start working, but I commit/pushed the changes for this.

Essentially I took solutions 1 and 2 and ended up blending them with 3 as well, since a lot of the raw SQL was annoying me. I added some relations and scopes to a couple of models to make it easier to set up the loops and queries. I added a few constants to make setting the flags in the users_deployment_notifications.notified field a bit easier to grok when looking at the code.

notified now can have 3 options:
0 (which previously was simply used for "not yet sent") is our "Pending" status, so it's a message that is pending delivery.
1 (which previously was simply used for "has been sent") is our "Notified" status. It has successfully been sent to the user.
2 is our "Processing" status, this is set at the top of our loop and saved so that any subsequent loops will ignore it and move to the next item if it happens to come in to a differently running cron job.

At the top of our loop we "refresh" the data of the model to check and see if that status was changed via some other means (i.e. another cron instance). As long as it's still pending, we set it to "processing" and continue on with the script. We may want to generate some cleanup script that finds orphaned notifications stuck in "processing" status and tries to fire them off.

The users_deployment_notifications.not_notified status was previously set if an email failed, but there was nothing in place to do anything about that. After consulting with Garth we decided that we'd use this to track the number of times we attempt to send it. On a failed send, we reset the notified status to "pending" and increment our sends. At the moment our default number of retries is 2, so a total of 3 attempts (initial, retry 1, retry 2), and the scope I created for that can be overwritten on a given method (ex ->maxRetries(10)). As of now, we retry an email 2 more times and then it sits in the "not notified" state. Again, a similar cleanup script could be run to do something with these, either set a status to something for later tracking, deleting the record, etc. As before, we save the last error message retrieved from the email sending functions so we can see why it wasn't properly sent.

I tested this in a few different ways, first setting up my local environment to log emails rather than send them (MAIL_DRIVER=log). I triggered the script into two separate instances with limits of 10, 20, 50, 100, and then 300 and reset the database after each try, checking to see how many records were being sent, and tracking if duplicate IDs were being sent. It's not a perfect test, but without a full environment and perhaps a dummy email to send to it's difficult to say exactly, but the results showed that none of the IDs were being touched on twice.

","id":"4-16","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"garthpmurray","name":"Garth Murray","$type":"User"},"created":1586357095670,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Per conversation with @Kris Anolfo let's go ahead and adding in a bunch of execution logging and see how far we can scale this.

When we deploy this, lets also plan on sending out a massive 6k email blast just to test the system.

","id":"4-18","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"rdupont","name":"Rick Dupont","$type":"User"},"created":1586372483482,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Updated the project with a "cleanup" script. At the moment the script will take anything older than an hour and re-queue it. However, in hindsight we should probably do something other than just re-queue it, as the notification after a certain time frame may no longer be applicable.

Proposal: if the notification is older than 1 day we set the not_notified field to 1 and set the error field to "Notification expired after 1 day". IF the notification is less than 1 day but older than 1 hour, we set the notified to 0 in order to re-queue it for the next batch of emails to go out.

","id":"4-19","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"garthpmurray","name":"Garth Murray","$type":"User"},"created":1586374906894,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

@Kris Anolfo could we get a ruling on this?

I think that if a notification doesn't go out because the script stops for some reason as long as it's not like a week old the email should still go out, but let us know.

","id":"4-20","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"rdupont","name":"Rick Dupont","$type":"User"},"created":1586440864469,"updated":null,"textPreview":"

Added a new commit with the following updates:

  • Added logging for the start/finish of the deploy script, as well as added success/fail counts
  • Added new logging option emailLog that is used to log information for any emailing functions
  • Added fullname and location field for users and notifications to prevent re-use of string concats
  • Modified switch statement to be driven by assignment type ID rather than string, added appropriate constants for the AssignmentTypes model
  • Created new method and route for a cleanup script as described above, with the modification of expiring after 1 day swapping to 1 week.

@Kris Anolfo do you also want to remove the GRS Application Received field as well?

","id":"4-2","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"Kanolfo","name":"Kris Anolfo","$type":"User"},"created":1581969925573,"updated":1589909240733,"textPreview":"

@Garth Murray I believe GRS Application Received needs to stay as that date is used to track when an adjuster needs to renew their 1099 application. However I reached out to Linda to confirm and will circle back around when she responds. The field GRS Application Requested is from an old workflow and does not apply anymore so it can be removed.

","id":"4-3","$type":"IssueComment"},{"author":{"login":"Kanolfo","name":"Kris Anolfo","$type":"User"},"created":1582037584951,"updated":1589909240733,"textPreview":"

@Garth Murray Linda confirmed that both fields can be removed. It's not super important to capture when we received someone's application, just that we have one. We upload a copy of the application itself to the adjuster's profile which captures the date, so we will have that information available to us if it's needed for some reason.
